pullRequest.body:
We add two sections to the file `RingTheory/LaurentSeries`: 
* `Dense`, proving that the rational functions are dense in the Laurent Series
* Comparison, providing the isomorphism between the `X`-adic completion of rational functions with Laurent Series, and then specializing this to an isomorphism between the unit ball in the former with power series.



Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutós Fernandez @mariainesdff

@riccardobrasca OK, this `erw` business opens a worms can. I have tried to dig a bit, and it really seems related to the interplay between [IsLocalization.lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Defs.html#IsLocalization.lift) and [IsLocalization.sec](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Defs.html#IsLocalization.sec) which sometimes require `erw` instead of `rw`. I am willing to get a better perspective and to work on this, but I believe this is out of the scope of this PR, so I'd prefer to have it go (at least insofar this `erw` business is concerned) and then come back later with some modifications if I can figure out how to improve the state of affairs.

> @riccardobrasca OK, this `erw` business opens a worms can. LGTM, thanks a lot!

The file is getting bigger and bigger, do you think it is possible to split it? (In another PR).
Are you intentionally including 120 `*`s on this line?
Yes, I was, to remind me I had to finish the doc... and then forgot to remove them 😭 Now fixed.

```suggestion
    simpa using (intValuation_le_one (PowerSeries.idealX K) F).trans_lt h_neg
```
this also works... but it is a bit less squeezed.
There was a diamond about this one, right? Or something similar, I don't remember.
About this very one I do not remember, bit it could be. I'll try to have a look on Zulip.
I was thinking about [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/compiling.20behaviour.20within.20one.20file/near/452600793) discussion
I forgot that the diamond is now solved, let's forget about it.
Do you understand why we need `erw`?
Same as above.
Nope, and I spent a while trying to understand it. I suspect it is the `coe` from `RatFunc` to `LaurentSeries`, but I will keep on digging.

```suggestion
    have : Valued.v ((ofPowerSeries ℤ K) (F - (trunc (d + 1) F))) ≤
```
It works without the `↑`, I think it is slightly more readable, but do as you wish.

```suggestion
    exact Int.zero_lt_one
```
Because why not.

```suggestion
  · set η : ℤₘ₀ˣ := Units.mk0 (Multiplicative.ofAdd f.order : Multiplicative ℤ) coe_ne_zero
```

```suggestion
theorem coe_range_dense : DenseRange ((↑) : RatFunc K → K⸨X⸩) := by
```
I am not 100% sure, but I think this is the usual spelling in theses cases.
Same as above.
Same.

```suggestion
  coe := (↑)
```

```suggestion
theorem LaurentSeries_coe (x : RatFunc K) : (LaurentSeriesPkg K).coe x = (x : K⸨X⸩) :=
```

```suggestion
abbrev RatFuncAdicCompl := adicCompletion (RatFunc K) (idealX K)
```
Can we upgrade this to an `AlgEquiv`?

Not straight away, because the `AdicCompl` construction does not yield `K`-algebra on `RatFunc`, basically because it is a construction on rings and not on algebras. But it is an important point, and I have added a ToDo.

```suggestion
open Filter WithZero
```

```suggestion
theorem tendsto_valuation (a : (idealX K).adicCompletion (RatFunc K)) :
```
Again, can this be an `AlgEquiv`?

```suggestion
    (LaurentSeriesRingEquiv K) F ∈ (idealX K).adicCompletionIntegers (RatFunc K) := by
```
I do not understand this suggestion (and simply applying it breaks the code).
Mmm, something went wrong with the VS Code extension, I think I just wanted to remove the `Polynomial.`

```suggestion
    (hx : x ∈ (idealX K).adicCompletionIntegers (RatFunc K)) :
```

```suggestion
      ((idealX K).adicCompletionIntegers (RatFunc K)).toSubring := by
```
Same for `AlgEquiv`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/LaurentSeries): finishes the proof that LaurentSeries are the X-adic completion of Rational Functions

@riccardobrasca OK, this `erw` business opens a worms can. I have tried to dig a bit, and it really seems related to the interplay between [IsLocalization.lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Defs.html#IsLocalization.lift) and [IsLocalization.sec](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Defs.html#IsLocalization.sec) which sometimes require `erw` instead of `rw`. I am willing to get a better perspective and to work on this, but I believe this is out of the scope of this PR, so I'd prefer to have it go (at least insofar this `erw` business is concerned) and then come back later with some modifications if I can figure out how to improve the state of affairs.
